alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 9:36PM EDT until August 20 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Harlan and Leslie. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stony Fork Junction, Blackmont, Callaway, Molus, Kettle Island, Balkan, Tacky Town, Black Snake, Miracle, Field, Rella, Coldiron, Beverly, Arjay, Saylor, Varilla, Blanche, Sandy Fork, Cary and Spruce Pine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
